name: Release 8.1.1 - Fix memory leak issue with parent property
body:
Released on 2025-07-01.

Made `parent` property be a weak ref to fix possible memory leak issue (via #286 which closes #285).

name: Release 8.1.0 - Add parent property to XMLElement
body:
Released on 2024-09-27.

Added the `parent` property to `XMLElement` (via [#278](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/278) which closes [#277](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/277))

name: 8.0.0 - Full support for Swift 6
body:
Released on 2024-09-17.

Most of this release was actually changing to swift-testing which doesn't impact the calling code at all; however, as part of #281, we noticed that some of the errors weren't marked with `Sendable` and thus couldn't be handled in swift-testing.

I did remove deprecated code (all methods that had been renamed years ago).

Note that as [CocoaPods has gone into maintenance mode](https://blog.cocoapods.org/CocoaPods-Support-Plans/), I haven't _yet_ created an 8.0 CocoaPods release. If there is enough interest, though, I can consider it. I suspect that most people who are using Swift 6 are _also_ on Swift Package Manager.

name: 7.0.0 - Rename deserialization protocols for clarity, improve usability of error types, etc.
body:
## Renaming XMLIndexerDeserializable protocol and Adding XMLValueDeserialization protocol

I renamed `XMLIndexerDeserializable` to be `XMLObjectDeserialization` - its purpose is to deserialize object structures like classes or structs. So, multiple values. Then, there is a new protocol named `XMLValueDeserialization` - it serves the purpose of both `XMLElementDeserializable` and `XMLAttributeDeserializable`. It is only used for custom value deserialization. I hope this will clarify the usage a lot. It makes sense to me anyway!

This should cover the use case at <https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/discussions/148>.

## Usability of Errors

Multiple times when helping people, I'd notice that the `nodeIsInvalid` error would get thrown, but the error message was just about impossible to determine what was wrong. The code had implemented `CustomStringConvertible` but everyone was using `localizedDescription`. Now, errors implement `LocalizedError`, too, so it is a lot more obvious to see the elements that had caused issues.

## Code Reorganization

The code had all been lumped into two Swift files since the beginning. It was unwieldy then, but it has just gotten worse. So I gave in and broke them all out into their own files by type. _Much better_.

name: 6.0.0 - Rename main class from SWXMLHash to XMLHash
body:
Released on 2021-09-28.

- Rename main class from `SWXMLHash` to `XMLHash` so that the module name (i.e. `SWXMLHash`) doesn't conflict with the class name. There are a decent number of issues related to naming conflicts so hopefully this will avoid them. Fixes #242, see also links on PR #246 where other similar issues are documented.

name: Official/full Swift 5.1 compatibility
body:
Released on 2019-08-28.

* Added official/full Swift 5.1 compatibility (via #216)
  * Note that API compatibility hasn't changed... it is a major version upgrade to support new language features.

name: Added Xcode 10.2 and Swift 5.0 support
body:
Released on 2019-03-29.

- Added Xcode 10.2, Swift 5.0 support (via [#210](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/210))

name: Added RawRepresentable String support
body:
Released on 2019-03-06.

* Added support for using String backed RawRepresentables in place of Strings for revelant APIs (via [#204](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/207))

name: Fix - issue with subsequent lazy parsing calls
body:
Released on 2018-12-11.

* Fix issue with lazy parsing and multiple calls (via [#204](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/204) and [#203](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/203))

name: Fix - cast warning with Swift 4.2 on Linux
body:
Released on 2018-11-26.

* Fix cast warning with Swift 4.2 on Linux (via [#201](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/201))

name: Changed - Added swift_version to podspec
body:
Released on 2018-10-15.

* Add `swift_version` to `SWXMLHash.podspec` (via [#198](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/198))

name: Changed - WATCHOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET set to 3.0
body:
Released on 2018-09-18.

* Bump `WATCHOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET` to `3.0` (via [#193 (https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/193))

name: Changed - bumped SWIFT_VERSION to 4.0
body:
Released on 2018-08-04.

* Bump `SWIFT_VERSION` to `4.0` (via [#191](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/191))

name: Feature - innerXML added
body:
Released on 2018-05-07.

* Added `innerXML` to elements (via [#188](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/188) and [#168](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/168))

name: Feature - XML parsing error checking
body:
Released on 2018-03-10.

* Added XML validation config option (via [#169](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/169) and [#141](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/141))

name: Changed - silenced Swift 4.1 deprecation warnings with shim
body:
Released on 2018-03-08.

* Swift 4.1 deprecation warnings silenced (via [#181](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/181))

name: Changed - Filter is now filterAll and filterChildren
body:
Released on 2018-02-21.

* Changed `filter` support to `filterAll` and `filterChildren` (via [#178](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/178) and [#170](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/170))

name: Fix - issue with filter and deserialization
body:
Released on 2018-02-05.

* Fix issue with `filter` and deserialization (via [#177](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/177))

name: Feature - filter support
body:
Released on 2018-02-04.

* Added `filter` support (via [#171](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/174) and [#167](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/170))

name: Fix - issue with CDATA parsing in Linux
body:
Released on 2018-01-21.

Fixed CDATA parsing in Linux (via #171 and #167)

name: Feature - userInfo support
body:
Released on 2018-01-15.

Added `userInfo` support (via [#171](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/171) and [#167](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/167)).

name: Fix - issue with XMLIndexer.byKey(_:)
body:
Released on 2017-11-10.

* Fix `XMLIndexer.byKey(_:)` bug (fixed in [#165](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/165))

name: Fix - characters deprecation
body:
Released on 2017-11-09.

* Fix `characters` deprecation (issue [#163](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/163) fixed in [#164](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/164))

name: Fix - off by one error in byIndex
body:
Released on 2017-09-28.

* Fix off by one `byIndex` error (issue [#155](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/issues/155) fixed in [#156](https://github.com/drmohundro/SWXMLHash/pull/156))

name: Xcode 9 Compatibility Release
body:
Released on 2017-09-21.

Xcode 9 related compatibility fixes (via #152). See also #151.

name: Temporary Fix - Disabling Code Coverage for Carthage
body: Disable code coverage related to Carthage. (see #149)

name: Feature - Allow for custom string encoding
body:
Released on 2017-08-27.

Added new config option to allow for overriding the string encoding (via #119).

name: Xcode 9 beta compatibility
body:
Released on 2017-06-01.

Added recommended Xcode 9.3 project settings (via #144).

name: Feature - caseInsensitive lookup
body:
Released on 2017-06-01.

Added `caseInsensitive` lookup options (via #137).

name: Swift 4.0 Release
body:
Released on 2017-05-15.

* Changed all enums to be camel cased (e.g. thisValue versus ThisValue) to match the Swift naming recommendations
* Removed `Sequence` from `XMLIndexer` to avoid a conflict with the `element` property coming in Swift 4
  * As a result, `for-in` no longer works directly against `XMLIndexer`; however, `for-in` works just fine against the `.all` method
* Changed `.text` to no longer be optional

(via #133, #134 and #135)
